name: s3://eodata/CLMS/bio-geophysical/snow_state/clms_wsi_sar-wet-snow_europe_utm_60m_daily_v2
browserSearchPath: CLMS Bio-geophysical Parameters, Snow, Snow State
collectionDescription: The SAR Wet Snow (SWS) product provides the wet snow extent for high mountain areas with a spatial resolution of 60 m x 60 m. It is generated in near real-time for selected high mountain areas at European scale based on C-band Synthetic Aperture Radar satellite data from the Sentinel-1 constellation, from 2016 to present. More information here.

layers.shortDescription: Wet Snow classification in high Mountains areas
layers.longDescription: Wet Snow classification performed in high Mountains areas as described in the documentation. The possible values are wet snow (110), and Dry snow or snow-free or patchy snow (125). The dataset is also masked with the following classes: radar Shadow, layover, or foreshortening (200), water (210), forest (220), urban areas (230), non-mountain areas (240) and no data (255).

layers.shortDescription: Quality layer for the wet snow classification (WSM) layer
layers.longDescription: Quality layer providing basic assessment of the wet snow classification layer.
